item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Helvy Tiana Rosa
item.description: "You are what you write." -- Helvy Tiana Rosa

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "Writing is a way of talking without being interrupted." -- Jules Renard

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "This is how you do it: you sit down at the keyboard and you put one word after another until its done. It's that easy, and that hard." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "That's why I write, because life never works except in retrospect. You can't control life, at least you can control your version." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "Was everyone else really as alive as she was?...If the answer was yes, then the world, the social world, was unbearably complicated, with two billion voices, and everyone's thoughts striving in equal importance and everyone's claim on life as intense, and everyone thinking they were unique, when no one was." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "She lay in the dark and knew everything." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: brandnewcycle add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "No one knows anything, really. It's all rented, or borrowed." -- Ian McEwan
